title: Worked Solution
text: To get at least one tail, there are three possible outcomes: HT, TH, and TT. The probability of getting HT and TH is $$2\frac{1}{2} \frac{1}{2}=\frac{1}{4}$$. The probability of getting TT is $$\frac{1}{4}$$. Therefore, the probability of getting at least one tail is $$\frac{1}{4}+\frac{1}{4}=\frac{1}{2}$$. The probability that both faces are the same is $$\frac{1}{2}$$. Therefore, the probability that we get at least one tail and both faces are the same is $$\frac{1}{2} \frac{1}{2}=\frac{1}{4}$$.
